docs.text: Welcome to Ye's Homepage Ye is currently a pre-postdoc in Multimodal Imaging in Neuro Disorders Lab (MIND) and IDEA group at University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill working with Dr.Pew-Thian Yap and Dr.Dinggang Shen . Ye received him the Ph.D. degree (worked on Neuroimage) from Zhejiang University of Technology [Dr.Yuanjing Feng] in December 2018. (https://www.ie.zjut.edu.cn/xxgcxy/ueditor/jsp/upload/file/20180412/1523518992965036975.pdf)). Before joining MIND, he worked in the Laboratory of Mathematics in Imaging (LMI) and the Surgical Planning Laboratory (SPL) at Harvard Medical School (HMS) working with Lauren J O' Donnell and Fan Zhang ) from 2016 to 2017. His current research mainly focuses on the methodologies in Computational neuroimaging on diffusion/structural/functional MRI. He is interested in Quantitative imaging, Tractography-based Parcellation, Microstructure imaging, and Machine learning. News 2019-1 * Ye joined the MIND Lab and IDEA group at University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill working with Dr.Pew-Thian Yap 2018-12 * Ye received the Ph.D. degree 2018-07 * Ye received the student travel award from MICCAI'2018 * One paper has been accepted for ORAL presentation at MICCAI'2018 2018-06 * One paper (co-author) has been accepted for publication at Brain research * One paper (second author) has been accepted for publication at Neuroimage 2018-05 * Two papers has been acctpted for publication at MICCAI'2018 * One paper has been accepted for publication at Neuroimage 2018-04 * One paper has been accepted for publication at OHBM'2018 * One paper (second author) has been accepted for publication at ISMRM'2018
docs.title: Home

Ye received him the Ph.D. degree (worked on Neuroimage) from Zhejiang University of Technology [Dr.Yuanjing Feng] in December 2018. Before joining MIND, he worked in the Laboratory of Mathematics in Imaging (LMI) and the Surgical Planning Laboratory (SPL) at Harvard Medical School (HMS) working with Lauren J O' Donnell and Fan Zhang ) from 2016 to 2017. His current research mainly focuses on the methodologies in Computational neuroimaging on diffusion/structural/functional MRI. He is interested in Quantitative imaging, Tractography-based Parcellation, Microstructure imaging, and Machine learning.

docs.text: Infomation Ye Wu Ph.D. Student, Computer Science Keywords: Neuroimag, Diffusion MRI, Deep learning, Machine learning Email (Main): amri.wuye@gmail.com Email (Work): wuye4567@email.unc.edu Email (Work): wuye@zjut.edu.cn Google Scholar HomePage News : Two papers are accepted by MICCAI'18 Overview Ye is currently a research scholar in Multimodal Imaging in Neuro Disorders Lab (MIND) and IDEA group at University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill working with Dr.Pew-Thian Yap and Dr.Dinggang Shen , also a PhD student at Zhejiang University of Technology working with Dr.Yuanjing Feng ). Before joining MIND, he worked in the Laboratory of Mathematics in Imaging (LMI) and the Surgical Planning Laboratory (SPL) at Harvard Medical School (HMS) working with Lauren J O' Donnell and Fan Zhang ) from 2016 to 2017. He will receive his Ph.D. degree in Computer Science (Neuroimage) from Zhejiang University of Technology in December 2018. His current research mainly focuses on the methodologies in Computational neuroimaging on diffusion/structural/functional MRI. He is interested in Quantitative imaging, Tractography-based Parcellation, Microstructure imaging, and Machine learning. docs.text: Ye is currently a research scholar in Multimodal Imaging in Neuro Disorders Lab (MIND) and IDEA group at University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill working with Dr.Pew-Thian Yap and Dr.Dinggang Shen , also a PhD student at Zhejiang University of Technology working with Dr.Yuanjing Feng ). Before joining MIND, he worked in the Laboratory of Mathematics in Imaging (LMI) and the Surgical Planning Laboratory (SPL) at Harvard Medical School (HMS) working with Lauren J O' Donnell and Fan Zhang ) from 2016 to 2017. He will receive his Ph.D. degree in Computer Science (Neuroimage) from Zhejiang University of Technology in December 2018. His current research mainly focuses on the methodologies in Computational neuroimaging on diffusion/structural/functional MRI. He is interested in Quantitative imaging, Tractography-based Parcellation, Microstructure imaging, and Machine learning.
